title: What are the standard mastery and rune pages atm?
body: I know they're probably 21 and 9, but it's been 6 months since I've played, I'm wondering what the specific mastery choices are and why.

replies.body:
Depends on the champ/role/how you plan to play

21/9/0 or 21/0/9 are your general Offense heavy ones (depends on if you need mana regen or more sustain early)

Obviously it's all based on how you plan to play the game out.

Yeah like I said, I assume they're 95% "21 9" pages, but it's been so long I'm not sure which mastery choices are stronger than others to make up those 30 points.

eg. Are Butcher and Feast good? The numbers seem rather small(3 health 1 mana). Is Double-Edged Sword something you always want to take? Ranged generally shouldn't be taking much damage, but at the same time you're never going to go through a game without taking **some**.

That's just the first tier of offense.

Ah you want a full run down.

Your general 21 in Offense as AD depends on if you rely on spells or autos.
Take 4 in either Fury or sorcery (note that if you have even a small reliance on CD's the CDR is better then the AS, cause honestly the AS is weak)
From here 3 in brute force and 1 in either Double edged sword or butcher (you can take exposed weakness but it's generally pretty meh.)
1 in Martial Mastery and 3 in exectutioner is good
1 in Dangerous game and 3 in Warlord are your next 4
3 in devastating strikes, and then if you are going to crit, 1 in Frenzy, if not, then place it wherever you feel you need the point (This can be the opposite of what you took for DES or butcher so you have both).
Finish it off with 1 point in havoc.

Feast is honestly rather weak in my opinion and i don't take it.
What about other roles such as Support or Top?

Honestly my suggestion is to go find your champ on a site like lolking, and look at the masterys they give as a general guide.

Because support varies WAY to much to even bother trying to mention what each one is, and generally your trying to build to your champion rather then your position anyway.
Is Lolking a generally acceptable site for things like that? Mobafire used to get laughed at a lot.

Well as long as you go to the site with the realization it's a guide and not doctrine then your fine, play with what suits you is generally the best idea, these things just help give a guide for it, the main reason there are problems with sites like this (in the case of mobafire for example) is that bronze level people would go onto them, and go and follow the guide as if it couldn't be changed/modified and then would say this in chat, when they are getting their asses handed to them cause they aren't playing the champion right.
